text: Field Marshal Muhammad Qasim Fahim (9 October 1957 â€“ 9 March 2014; ) also known as "Marshal Fahim Khan") was an Afghan military commander, and politician. He was the Vice President of Afghanistan from November 2009 until his death in March 2014.BBC News He was the Defense Minister of the Afghan Transitional Administration, beginning in 2002. He also served as Vice President of Afghanistan from June 2002 to December 2004. Marshal Fahim was a member of Afghanistan's Tajik ethnic group. ==References== Category:1957 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Afghan military people Category:Tajik people Category:Vice presidents of Afghanistan Category:21st-century Afghan people Category:20th-century Afghan people
title: Muhammad Qasim Fahim
